document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the Neochauliodes sinensis species-group (Megaloptera: Corydalidae: Chauliodinae)

heading.emphasis:
Key to males of the
Neochauliodes sinensis
species–group

paragraph.keyLead: 2. Hindwing with basal half blackish brown ( Liu & Yang 2005a : Fig. 1 ) ...................................................... 3

3. Pronotum black ( Liu & Yang 2005a : Fig. 1 ); male tenth sternum in lateral view with acute tip ( Liu & Yang 2005a : Fig. 11 ) ............................................................................
Neochauliodes acutatus Liu & Yang

– Pronotum pale yellow ( Liu & Yang 2005a : Fig. 4 ); male tenth sternum in lateral view with blunt tip ( Liu & Yang 2005a : Fig. 22 ) ...........................................................................
Neochauliodes fuscus Liu & Yang
– Distal hyaline area small, separated into several tiny hyaline spots ( Fig. 3 ; Liu & Yang 2005a : Fig. 10 ).. 7

7. Male tenth tergum asymmetric with each other ( Figs. 18–19 ); male tenth sternum in ventral view with truncate tip ( Fig. 20 ) ....................................................................
Neochauliodes jiangxiensis Yang & Yang

– Male tenth tergum symmetric with each other (Liu & Yang 2005: Fig. 44 ); male tenth sternum in lateral view with rounded tip (Liu & Yang 2005: Fig. 45 ) ....................
Neochauliodes wuminganus Yang & Yang
8. Male tenth sternum in lateral view with apex inflated ( Figs. 10 , 14 , 32 ) .................................................... 9
– Male tenth sternum in lateral view with apex not inflated ( Figs. 18 , 21 , 24 , 36 )...................................... 16
– Male tenth sternum in ventral view with V–shaped proximal margin ( Figs. 25 , 33 )................................ 10
– Male tenth sternum narrow, 4.0 times as long as wide ( Liu & Yang 2006a : Figs. 22 , 26 )........................ 11

11. Wing with dense marks ( Liu & Yang 2006a : Fig. 6 ); male tenth sternum in ventral view with distal lateral margin not expanded ( Liu & Yang 2006a : Fig. 26 ) ....................
Neochauliodes punctatolosus Liu & Yang

– Wing with sparse marks ( Liu & Yang 2006a : Fig. 5 ); male tenth sternum in ventral view with distal lateral margin expanded outwards ( Liu & Yang 2006a : Fig. 22 ) ......................
Neochauliodes parcus Liu & Yang

– Forewing with transverse band wide and entire ( Fig. 7 ) ..........................
Neochauliodes rotundatus Tjeder

13. Hindwing with median transverse band narrow and separated into sparse small marks ( Liu & Yang 2005b : Fig. 5 )....................................................................................................
Neochauliodes sparsus Liu & Yang

15. Wing with dense marks at tip ( Liu & Yang 2005a : Fig. 8 ); male tenth sternum in ventral view about 3.0 times as long as distal margin ( Liu & Yang 2005a : Fig. 37 ) ...................
Neochauliodes nigris Liu & Yang

– Wing with sparse marks at tip ( Fig. 9 ); male tenth sternum in ventral view about 2.0 times as long as distal margin ( Kimmins 1954 : Fig. 19b ) ..........................................................
Neochauliodes truncatus Kimmins
– Pronotum yellowish brown laterally with pair of blackish vittae ( Liu & Yang 2005b : Fig. 1 )................. 18

17. Forewing with median transverse band extended to Cu ( Liu & Yang 2005a : Fig. 7 ); male tenth sternum wide with tip slightly incised ( Liu & Yang 2005a : Fig. 33 ) ..................
Neochauliodes meridionalis Weele

– Forewing with median transverse band extended to posterior margin ( Liu & Yang 2005a : Fig. 5 ); male tenth sternum slender with tip not incised ( Liu & Yang 2005a : Fig. 26 ) ...................................................... ...................................................................................................
Neochauliodes guangxiensis Yang & Yang

19. Forewing with median transverse band separated into several small spots ( Liu & Yang 2005b : Fig. 1 ); male tenth sternum in ventral view with apex strongly narrowed into a digitiform process ( Liu & Yang 2005b : Fig. 8 ) ..................................................................................
Neochauliodes digitiformis Liu & Yang

– Forewing with median transverse band entire ( Figs. 5, 8 ); male tenth sternum in ventral view with apex not narrowed into digitiform process ( Figs. 25 , 37 ).................................................................................. 17

21. Hindwing with median transverse band longitudinally separated into several small subquadrate spots ( Liu & Yang 2006a : Fig. 1 ); male tenth sternum in ventral view wide lingulate with pair of small distal dents ( Liu & Yang 2006a : Fig. 8 ) ..........................................................
Neochauliodes bicuspidatus Liu & Yang

– Hindwing with median transverse band entire ( Liu & Yang 2005b : Fig. 3 ); male tenth sternum in ventral view subtrapezoidal without distal dents ( Liu & Yang 2005b : Fig. 12 )........................................................ .......................................................................................................
Neochauliodes parasparsus Liu & Yang
